A cool feature of @UniswapExchange is that an ERC20 token is issued when you add liquidity - a unique token per pair. This means you can:

a) use UNI liquidity tokens as collateral 
b) create markets for all UNI tokens...on Uniswap

1090770561507168256.text: PS - If you're trying to figure out how to "time the ETH bottom", don't. By providing equal amounts of liquidity in ETH and Dai in @UniswapExchange you'll effectively be buying ETH on the way down and selling it on the way up. Stress free trading strategy.

1120423109440438275.text:
TLDR:

 Funds are safe for all current liquidity pools. 

 Liquidity pools for tokens that allow arbitrary callbacks in their transfer functions (ERC777) can have re-entrancy attacks. Upgradable tokens with controllers could be upgraded to allow this type of attack.

1099877336852455424.text:
Warning: contains rounding and ignores compounding.

Still a useful framing.

1099877089065553920.text:
Daily volume on Uniswap (almost) equals annualized fees. Daily volume divided by liquidity (almost) equals annualized returns

annualizedFees = dailyVolume*0.003*365  = 1.095*dailyVolume
annualizedReturns = dailyVolume/totalLiquidity

This is true per pair and systemwide

1098101874530623488.text:
Re-reposting after fixing typo:

$4.2M * 0.003 = $12.6k fees per week

Ignoring compounding, thats $655,000 annualized.

With $3M in reserves, thats a 21.8% annualized return on liquidity in Uniswap this week. 

Thats greater than arb losses from a 4x in price differential.

Update: You can now visit https://uniswap.fun/  to trade /r/ethtrader reddit karma (DONUTs) without needing to paste in the address 

 This also demonstrates how easy and fast it is to set up a modified fork of the frontend!https://twitter.com/UniswapExchange/status/1087366193181265925 …

1087366193181265925.text:
You can now trade /r/ethtrader reddit karma on @UniswapExchange! 

1) Use the reddit <> ERC20 bridge at https://donut.dance/ 

2) Paste the address: 0x23d80c4ee8fb55d4183dd9329296e176dc7464e1 into the token selection field on https://uniswap.exchange 

3) Enjoy that sweet karmapic.twitter.com/aGRbdYfiUi

1072286775836590080.text: 4/ @UniswapExchange supports custom exchange contracts - so creating one that supports BNB will not be difficult. But this custom support is only needed because BNB is NOT an ERC20 token - it does not contain a valid implementation of EIP20.https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-20.md …

1072286775115161611.text: 3/ Fortunately this bug was discovered by an engineer at @TotleCrypto while only ~$2000 dollars worth of tokens were locked up in the pool. Unfortunately, these funds are locked permanently. BNB has been removed from the Uniswap website. Apologies to anyone affected.

1072286774251216897.text: 2/ What makes the @binance bug so egregiously bad is that the transferFrom() function has a return value but the transfer() function does not. This means that contracts that expect return values can pull BNB from your account but can't transfer it back out.

1072286773554876416.text:
1/  WARNING: BNB providers

Due to a bug in the @binance  BNB contract it's possible to add liquidity to the Uniswap BNB<>ETH liquidity pool but not remove it. 

This bug is a variation on the "missing return value" ERC20 bug which affects several tokens.https://medium.com/coinmonks/missing-return-value-bug-at-least-130-tokens-affected-d67bf08521ca …
